text: - [Instructor] Welcome everyone.

In this video, I'm gonna
cover a newly added feature
in AWS Security Hub that allows you

to receive future updates
about Security Hub.
You can do this by subscribing

to an Amazon SNS Security
Hub announcements topic.

After subscribing, you'll
receive notifications
about newly released features,
updates to existing features,

the addition of new standards
and controls and other events.
This is a great way to proactively keep up

with all the great new
features being added
by the Security Hub team.
So let's jump into the console
and see how to get this set up.

Now that we're in the
console, we're gonna set up

our Simple Notification
Service subscription.
Make sure to be in the region

that you want to set
up the notification in.
I'm in us-east-2, Ohio,

and we'll click on Simple
Notification Service.

On the left side, let's
click on subscriptions
and we will create a new subscription.
I'm gonna paste the topic ARN.
You can get this topic ARN
from the Security Hub documentation.

In this example, I'll
set the protocol as email
and I'll put it in an email address
and click Create subscription.
Now, if you put in your email address,

you'll get an email to
confirm this subscription.
Make sure to confirm that subscription
so you can start receiving these updates.

As we can see, in a very
short amount of time

we were able to set up that
simple notification subscription
so that after we subscribe,
we can start receiving notifications
about newly released features,
updates to existing features,

the addition of new standards
and controls and other events,

so that we're always staying
up to date on what's new
in the AWS Security Hub service.

So with that said, thanks
for watching this video.

And if you need any more
information about AWS Security Hub,
please visit aws.amazon.com/securityhub.
